brief: Add AI-powered personalized game recommendations to the Games24x7 app.
raw_data: User segmentation and session data available. Prior recommendation attempts had limited uplift (3-5%).

sections.problem_statement: Games24x7 currently lacks a personalized game recommendation system, potentially leading to reduced user engagement and retention. Users may struggle to discover new games that match their preferences, resulting in a suboptimal gaming experience. Implementing AI-powered personalized game recommendations will enhance user satisfaction, increase time spent on the app, and potentially boost in-app purchases.

goals_and_success_metrics.success_metric: 20% increase in average daily active users within 3 months of launch
50% of users try a recommended game within 1 month of feature launch
15% increase in 30-day retention rate within 6 months of launch
10% increase in average revenue per user within 3 months of launch

user_stories.story: I want to receive personalized game recommendations so that I can easily find new games that match my interests and playing style
I want the app to suggest games based on my skill level so that I can find challenging and engaging content
I want to see recommendations based on my playing history so that I can quickly jump back into games I enjoy
I want to receive diverse game suggestions so that I can explore the variety of games available on the platform

constraints: Must comply with data privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA) when collecting and processing user data
AI model must be optimized for mobile devices to ensure smooth performance
Recommendation system should work offline for users with limited internet connectivity
Integration with existing game library and user profile system required
Must support multiple languages to cater to Games24x7's diverse user base

milestones.milestone: Data collection and analysis system implementation

main_trends: Limited uplift (3-5%) from prior recommendation attempts
anomalies: Lower than expected impact from previous recommendation systems
causal_factors: Insufficient personalization in previous recommendation algorithms
Lack of real-time user behavior analysis
Limited consideration of user preferences and gaming history
Possible mismatch between recommended games and user interests
actionable_insights: Implement AI-powered recommendation system using deep learning techniques
Incorporate real-time user behavior analysis into the recommendation algorithm
Utilize collaborative filtering to identify similar users and their preferences
Develop a hybrid recommendation system combining content-based and collaborative filtering approaches
Conduct A/B testing to compare new AI-powered recommendations against previous methods
Analyze user segments to tailor recommendations for different player types
Implement feedback loops to continuously improve recommendation accuracy
Consider contextual factors such as time of day and device type in recommendations

sections.hypothesis: Implementing an AI-powered recommendation system using deep learning techniques will increase user engagement by 15% compared to the previous recommendation system.
sections.rationale: Deep learning techniques can better capture complex patterns in user behavior and preferences, potentially overcoming the limitations of previous recommendation attempts that showed only 3-5% uplift.
sections.test: Conduct an A/B test comparing the new AI-powered recommendation system against the previous system, measuring user engagement metrics such as time spent in the app, number of games played, and retention rates over a 4-week period.

sections.hypothesis: Incorporating real-time user behavior analysis into the recommendation algorithm will result in a 20% increase in click-through rates on recommended games.
sections.rationale: Real-time analysis can capture immediate user interests and preferences, addressing the lack of real-time user behavior analysis identified in the causal factors.
sections.test: Implement real-time behavior analysis for a subset of users and compare their click-through rates on recommended games with a control group using the current recommendation system over a 2-week period.

sections.hypothesis: Developing a hybrid recommendation system that combines content-based and collaborative filtering approaches will improve user satisfaction scores by 25%.
sections.rationale: A hybrid approach can leverage the strengths of both methods, potentially addressing the limited consideration of user preferences and gaming history noted in the causal factors.
sections.test: Deploy the hybrid recommendation system to a test group and measure user satisfaction through in-app surveys and feedback forms, comparing results with a control group using the current recommendation system over a 1-month period.

sections.hypothesis: Tailoring recommendations based on user segments will increase the average number of games played per session by 30% for each identified segment.
sections.rationale: Utilizing available user segmentation data can help address the possible mismatch between recommended games and user interests, as different segments may have distinct preferences.
sections.test: Implement segment-specific recommendations for identified user groups and track the average number of games played per session for each segment over a 3-week period, comparing results with historical data.
